snippet: The Federal Reserve says that more than 30 percent of Americans report irregular incomes that sabotage efforts to budget and save. Unreliable work hours are cited most often.
abstract: Financial volatility is a feature of life for millions of American workers whose paychecks fluctuate with the season, hourly schedule or size of a weekly commission; Federal Reserve survey based on 2013 data suggests problem has not only persisted as economy recovers but may even have worsened, with more than 30 percent of Americans reporting spikes and dips in their incomes.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve says that more than 30 percent of Americans report irregular incomes that sabotage efforts to budget and save. Unreliable work hours are cited most often.

headline.main: Unsteady Incomes Keep Millions Behind on Bills
